author: Special Correspondent
text:
The 49th convocation of Madurai Kamaraj University will be held on Friday (February 12) at the Mu.Va. Arangu. University chancellor and Governor K. Rosaiah would preside over the function.

Former Gujarat Chief Secretary D.J. Pandian will deliver the convocation address. According to a press release, as many as 64,656 candidates, including 442 Ph.D. research scholars and 71 medal winners, would receive the degrees. Higher Education Minister Palaniappan, Higher Education Secretary Apoorva and others would take part in the ceremony, the release added.

Hostellers stage protest

Condemning the lethargic attitude of the authorities in not providing basic amenities, hostellers at Madurai Kamaraj University resorted to a flash strike by staging a sit-in stir on Wednesday. There are as many as 11 hostel blocks on the campus. The students complained that by introducing new norms under the guise of delivering transparency in administration, the authorities took their own time even to provide fans and lights. After about six hours, Registrar (in charge) Muthumanickam visited them and assured to look into their grievances within a week, following which the hostellers withdrew their stir.
title: 49th convocation of MKU
